archdesc.bioghist: Mary L. Beasley (Mary Mattie Lou (Green) Beasley) was president of Unit 7, Detroit Housewives' League, a women's organization that supported Black-owned businesses and helped train Detroit's young African Americans for careers in business in the 1930s.
archdesc.scopecontent: Scrapbook contains newspaper clippings about successful African American entrepreneurs, scholars, athletes, religious leaders, lawyers, and representatives of other professional and civil circles. Also included are articles about educational institutions, professional meetings, and individual achievements of African Americans around the country, and clippings of advertisements of businesses. Also a clipping with Beasley's portrait with a short biographical sketch, and a November 1944 issue of "The Negro History Bulletin."
